page.title: 08M6 Motorway Junction 9.
page.content: Dominated by the works of{FH Lloyd,} {Jamesbridge}and overlooked by an elevated section of the M6 which intersects the NE corner. (Junction 9 serves Walsall/Wednesbury). The{Lloyd} {works,}over 90 acres, was founded in 1879 and in 1976 was employing over 3000 men, making steel castings of upto 30 tons. The castings for the {Thames flood barrier}were a recent prestige job. Since 1983 the works progressively closed down, now employs 134 with an Italian electric furnace producing goods by continous casting. Housing is predominantly council dating from the mid 30's. Both{Stuart} {Bathurst High School (R.C.)}and{Wood } {Green High School}are within this block. The church of{St Paul's,}on {Wood Green Road,}was built by the {Elwell}family (factory owners) in 1874.
